body: I divide my building in differents levels, after i choose one level to make my calculation. But the problem is that the rest of the building become nothing, but I want to take it into account in my calculation. Anyone can help me to solve this. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/vMQ5RJcyKDDKDHU3aSTxT0wpkG82W8EaI41H1p9PZpxSgrL0YVPu7DPUm8DoniJHleiZ1i1IZmfsqDOfVqVkJ1AkMpx03kot/ScreenShot051915at12.40PM.PNG) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/vMQ5RJcyKDBQVRhMgE4KkxSv7WLvbx3T8bbTZ-Ovpb*gGx*E1jbqG-JrJw1uxDu*BPokepA5PIaf1ykPShFBBOmWpsYS4rSp/ScreenShot051915at12.43PM.PNG)
topic: Integrate the rest of the building

replies.body:
Hi Sebastien,



Sorry that nobody get back to you on this question sooner. I think it would have helped if you could have uploaded a simplified example file.



If you are running an energy analysis, you can calculate the bounding box for the other floors and use EPContextSrf to add them as context.



If it's a daylighting simulation then just generate the test points for this floor and connect all the zones to the component.



Mostapha
